plating_types.name: Gold Plating
plating_types.description: Gold plating involves applying a thin layer of gold to a base metal, such as brass or sterling silver. This is a common plating method to give jewelry the appearance of solid gold without the high cost.

plating_types.name: Rhodium Plating
plating_types.description: Rhodium plating is a process where a thin layer of rhodium, a precious metal in the platinum family, is applied to jewelry. This plating is typically used for white gold jewelry to give it a bright, white, shiny finish and to prevent tarnishing.

plating_types.name: Silver Plating
plating_types.description: Silver plating involves applying a layer of silver over a base metal to give the item the appearance of solid silver. It's often used to improve the look of inexpensive jewelry or to create an aesthetic effect.

plating_types.name: Platinum Plating
plating_types.description: Platinum plating involves applying a thin layer of platinum over jewelry. It's often used to enhance the durability and appearance of white gold or sterling silver jewelry, giving it a durable, high-end finish.

plating_types.name: Palladium Plating
plating_types.description: Palladium plating involves using palladium, a member of the platinum group, to plate jewelry. This plating is hypoallergenic and provides a white, shiny finish.

plating_types.name: Nickel Plating
plating_types.description: Nickel plating is the application of a nickel layer onto jewelry. Itâ€™s often used as a base for other plating processes but is less common for direct use in high-quality jewelry due to the potential for allergic reactions.

plating_types.name: Copper Plating
plating_types.description: Copper plating involves applying a layer of copper to a piece of jewelry, often as a base layer for further plating. It is used to give a reddish-brown finish and can help with the longevity of other plating types.

plating_types.name: Rose Gold Plating
plating_types.description: Rose gold plating involves applying a layer of rose gold (a blend of gold, copper, and silver) to a piece of jewelry. It is used to give the piece a warm, pinkish hue, often associated with romantic or vintage-style jewelry.

plating_types.name: Black Rhodium Plating
plating_types.description: Black rhodium plating uses rhodium in a black color to give a dark, sleek, and edgy appearance. This plating is often used in modern and fashion-forward jewelry.

plating_types.name: Gold Vermeil
plating_types.description: Gold vermeil is a thicker and more durable version of gold plating, where a layer of gold (at least 10 karats) is applied to a base of sterling silver. It offers a rich, gold appearance at a more affordable price.

plating_types.name: Gold-Filled Plating
plating_types.description: Gold-filled jewelry involves a thicker layer of gold (at least 10 karat) bonded to a base metal, often brass. It is more durable and resistant to wear than regular gold plating.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Flawless (FL)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: A Flawless gemstone has no internal or external inclusions visible under 10x magnification. It is the highest clarity grade for gemstones and is extremely rare.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Internally Flawless (IF)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: An Internally Flawless gemstone has no internal inclusions visible under 10x magnification, but it may have minor surface blemishes that are not visible to the naked eye.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Very, Very Slightly Included (VVS1)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: VVS gemstones have minute inclusions that are very difficult to detect even under 10x magnification. VVS1 has fewer inclusions and is clearer than VVS2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Very, Very Slightly Included (VVS2)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: VVS gemstones have minute inclusions that are very difficult to detect even under 10x magnification. VVS1 has fewer inclusions and is clearer than VVS2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Very Slightly Included (VS1)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: VS gemstones have slight inclusions that are difficult to detect under 10x magnification but are typically visible under magnification. VS1 has fewer inclusions than VS2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Very Slightly Included (VS2)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: VS gemstones have slight inclusions that are difficult to detect under 10x magnification but are typically visible under magnification. VS1 has fewer inclusions than VS2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Slightly Included (SI1)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: SI gemstones have inclusions that are noticeable under 10x magnification and may or may not be visible to the naked eye. SI1 inclusions are less visible than SI2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Slightly Included (SI2)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: SI gemstones have inclusions that are noticeable under 10x magnification and may or may not be visible to the naked eye. SI1 inclusions are less visible than SI2.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Included (I1)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: Included gemstones have obvious inclusions that are visible to the naked eye and affect the overall appearance of the stone. I3 has the most visible and severe inclusions.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Included (I2)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: Included gemstones have obvious inclusions that are visible to the naked eye and affect the overall appearance of the stone. I3 has the most visible and severe inclusions.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Included (I3)
gemstone_clarity_types.description: Included gemstones have obvious inclusions that are visible to the naked eye and affect the overall appearance of the stone. I3 has the most visible and severe inclusions.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Transparent
gemstone_clarity_types.description: A gemstone with no visible inclusions and a completely clear appearance to the naked eye. It is typically used for gemstones that naturally form without noticeable internal flaws.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Semi-transparent
gemstone_clarity_types.description: Semi-transparent gemstones have minor inclusions or slight color variations that slightly reduce clarity, though they still allow light to pass through the stone.

gemstone_clarity_types.name: Opaque
gemstone_clarity_types.description: Opaque gemstones have so many inclusions that they do not allow light to pass through, making the stone appear solid. This is often the case with gemstones that are not typically used in high-quality jewelry.

gemstone_cuts.name: round brilliant
gemstone_cuts.description: the round brilliant cut is one of the most popular and widely used gemstone cuts, particularly for diamonds. it features 58 facets designed to maximize light reflection and brilliance.

gemstone_cuts.name: princess cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the princess cut is a square or rectangular shape with pointed corners, often used in engagement rings. it has a high number of facets that reflect light well, offering a brilliant shine.

gemstone_cuts.name: emerald cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the emerald cut is a rectangular shape with beveled corners and a stepped, ladder-like facet arrangement. it is known for its elegance and is often used for gemstones with high clarity.

gemstone_cuts.name: asscher cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the asscher cut is similar to the emerald cut but is square in shape with a more defined step-cut facet pattern. it often has a vintage or art deco aesthetic.

gemstone_cuts.name: cushion cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the cushion cut has rounded corners and larger facets, resembling a pillow shape. this cut is known for its vintage appeal and soft, romantic look.

gemstone_cuts.name: oval cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the oval cut is an elongated round shape that combines the brilliance of a round cut with a unique, elongated appearance. itâ€™s great for larger gemstones.

gemstone_cuts.name: marquise cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the marquise cut is an elongated shape with pointed ends, resembling a football or boat shape. this cut creates the illusion of a larger gemstone due to its length.

gemstone_cuts.name: pear cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the pear cut is a teardrop shape, with a rounded end and a pointed tip. it is elegant and timeless, often used in pendants and earrings.

gemstone_cuts.name: heart cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the heart cut is a variation of the pear cut, featuring a heart-shaped gemstone. it is a symbol of love and is often used in romantic or sentimental jewelry pieces.

gemstone_cuts.name: baguette cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the baguette cut is a long, rectangular shape with straight edges, typically with step-cut facets. this cut is often used as side stones in rings or as accent stones.

gemstone_cuts.name: trillion cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the trillion cut is a triangular shape with sharp, straight edges. it is a modern cut that can be used as the centerpiece or accent stones in jewelry.

gemstone_cuts.name: radiant cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the radiant cut is a rectangular or square cut with trimmed corners and brilliant facets. it combines the brilliance of the round brilliant cut with the shape of the emerald cut.

gemstone_cuts.name: cabochon cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the cabochon cut features a rounded, smooth top with a flat bottom, often used for opaque or translucent gemstones. this cut does not have facets and emphasizes the stone's color and texture.

gemstone_cuts.name: step cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the step cut is characterized by rows of facets that resemble steps, often used for square or rectangular gemstones. it provides a clean, modern look and highlights the clarity of the stone.

gemstone_cuts.name: rose cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the rose cut features a flat bottom with a domed top covered in triangular facets, giving the stone a rose-like appearance. itâ€™s commonly used for vintage-style jewelry.

gemstone_cuts.name: old mine cut
gemstone_cuts.description: the old mine cut is an antique diamond cut with a square or cushion shape and a high crown. it has fewer facets than modern cuts but offers a unique, vintage appeal.
